Disease.content:
Please identify the "Disease" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Disease". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: This study shows that 17alpha - ethinylestradiol ( EE ) - induced intrahepatic cholestasis in rats is associated with selective inhibition of the neutral pathway of bile salt ( BS ) synthesis .

Let's think step by step.

| Disease |
| --- |
| intrahepatic cholestasis |

In this paragraph, the disease mentioned is "intrahepatic cholestasis." This is a specific type of cholestasis, which is a condition characterized by the buildup of bile in the liver and obstruction of bile flow from the liver to the small intestine. Intrahepatic cholestasis refers to the type that occurs within the liver itself. The study mentioned in the paragraph is investigating the association between this condition and the inhibition of the neutral pathway of bile salt synthesis by 17alpha-ethinylestradiol (EE).

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Disease" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Disease".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Disease |
| --- |
| intrahepatic cholestasis |

Intrahepatic cholestasis is the disease mentioned in the paragraph. The paragraph describes a study that shows how 17alpha-ethinylestradiol (EE) induces intrahepatic cholestasis in rats and is associated with selective inhibition of the neutral pathway of bile salt synthesis. Therefore, intrahepatic cholestasis is the only entity in the paragraph that clearly refers to a disease.
